# cascade-rs

Pure Rust CAD kernel targeting 80/20 feature parity with OpenCASCADE.

**This checklist is auto-generated by `cargo run --bin validate-features`. Do not edit manually.**

## Architecture

```
cascade-rs/
├── src/
│   ├── lib.rs              # Main library
│   ├── primitive/          # Primitive shapes
│   ├── boolean/            # Boolean operations
│   ├── brep/               # BREP data structures
│   ├── curve/              # Curve types
│   ├── surface/            # Surface types
│   ├── modify/             # Shape modifications
│   ├── mesh/               # Tessellation
│   ├── io/                 # File I/O
│   └── query/              # Geometric queries
├── corpus/                 # Golden test corpus (OCCT-generated)
│   ├── primitives/
│   ├── booleans/
│   └── ...
├── tests/
│   └── feature_tests.rs    # Auto-generated from corpus
└── scripts/
    └── generate_corpus.py  # One-time OCCT corpus generation
```

## Validation

The feature checklist above is generated by running:

```bash
cargo run --bin validate-features
```

This:
1. Loads each test case from `corpus/`
2. Runs the cascade-rs implementation
3. Compares output against OCCT golden output
4. Updates README.md with pass/fail status

**A feature is only marked ✓ when ALL its test cases pass within tolerance (ε < 1e-6).**

## Test Corpus

The `corpus/` directory contains serialized test cases generated from OpenCASCADE. Each test case includes:

- `input.json` — Input geometry/parameters
- `expected.json` — Expected output (BREP topology + mesh)
- `metadata.json` — OCCT version, tolerance, etc.

To regenerate the corpus (requires OCCT installed):

```bash
cargo run --bin generate-corpus --features generate-corpus
```

## Contributing

1. Pick an unchecked feature from the list above
2. Implement in the appropriate module
3. Run `cargo run --bin validate-features`
4. PR only if your feature shows ✓ in the generated checklist
